content.html: It's been 0 days since I used @DasSurma's trick to remember the tar arguments to extract it: eXtract Zhe File (`tar -xzf file.tar.gz`)
content.value:
It's been 0 days since I used @DasSurma's trick to remember the tar arguments to extract it:

eXtract Zhe File (`tar -xzf file.tar.gz`)

content.html: or just remember "eXtract File", use `tar -xf file.tar.gz`, and let tar figure out which kind of archive it is. because if you're trying to use "Zeh" (which stands for gZip because obviously) only works on .gz, but will error out on .bz.
content.value:
or just remember "eXtract File", use `tar -xf file.tar.gz`, and let tar figure out which kind of archive it is.

because if you're trying to use "Zeh" (which stands for gZip because obviously) only works on .gz, but will error out on .bz.
